Data.event_text: 1 January - ISRO successfully launches its first X-Ray polarimeter satellite XPoSat to study the polarization of intense X-Ray sources in space.

links.text: -"ISRO to study black holes; launch of X-Ray Polarimeter Satellite today; here's all you need to know". Mint. 1 January 2024. Retrieved 1 January 2024.-

Data.event_text: 2 January - 20232024 Indian truckers' protests Protests are organized by Indian truckers against the severity of the newly proposed law in dealing with the hit-and-run cases.

links.text: -"Petrol pumps run dry across northern India as truckers protest new hit and run laws". The Independent. 3 January 2024. Retrieved 5 January 2024.-

Data.event_text: A court in Jaunpur sentences two men to death over the 2005 Jaunpur train bombing which killed 14 people.

links.text: -Pandey, Sanjay. "2005 Shramjeevi Express blast case accused get death penalty". Deccan Herald. Retrieved 3 January 2024.-

Data.event_text: A bus carrying 45 passengers collides with a truck in Golaghat district in Assam killing 12 and injuring 30 others.

links.text: -"Bus crash kills 12 in northeast India". EFE Noticias. 3 January 2024. Retrieved 30 January 2024.-

Data.event_text: 5 January - 2024 Sandeshkhali violence A team of ED officers are injured in clashes with local supporters of Shahjahan Sheikh in Sandeshkhali, West Bengal.
ISRO's Aditya-L1 spacecraft on India's first solar mission, successfully enters its final orbit around the first Sun-Earth Lagrangian point (L1), approximately 1.5 million kilometers from the earth.

links.text: -"Halo-Orbit Insertion of Aditya-L1 Successfully Accomplished". ISRO. 6 January 2024. Retrieved 6 January 2024.-

Data.event_text: Three Maldives government ministers (Maryam Shiuna, Malsha Shareef and Mahzoom Majid) make derogatory remarks against the Indian Prime Minister on social media, causing massive backlash and tourism boycott in India, and triggering the 2024 India-Maldives diplomatic row, which forced the Maldivian government to suspend the ministers.

links.text: -"Boycott Maldives sparks ticket cancellation". Business Standard. 6 January 2024. Retrieved 1 June 2024.-
-"Maldives govt suspends 3 ministers over racist remarks against PM Modi for Lakshadweep post: Reports". The Times of India. 7 January 2024. ISSN 0971-8257. Retrieved 1 June 2024.-
-"Maldives govt suspends 3 ministers over racist remarks against PM Modi for Lakshadweep post: Reports". The Times of India. 7 January 2024. ISSN 0971-8257. Retrieved 1 June 2024.-

Data.event_text: 7 January - Tribal protests are held in Hasdeo Arand, Chhattisgarh against the felling of four lakh trees at the Parsa Coal Mines, operated by Adani Group and Rajasthan Rajya Vidyut Utpadan Nigam.

links.text: -"Decode Politics: A change of govt, and return of Hasdeo Aranya tribal protests in Chhattisgarh". The Indian Express. 12 January 2024. Retrieved 29 March 2024.-

Data.event_text: 12 January - Prime Minister Modi inaugurates Mumbai Trans Harbour Link, the longest bridge in India that connects Mumbai with Navi Mumbai.

links.text: -"Speed limit 100 km/hr, no bikes and autos: All about India's longest sea bridge". India Today. 11 January 2024. Retrieved 15 January 2024.-
-"Atal Setu news: PM Modi to inaugurate Mumbai Trans Harbour Link today". mint. 12 January 2024. Retrieved 15 January 2024.-

Data.event_text: 14 January - Rahul Gandhi commences his Bharat Jodo Nyay Yatra from Imphal, Manipur.

links.text: -"Rahul Gandhi-led Bharat Jodo Nyay Yatra begins on January 14 from Imphal". The Hindu. 14 January 2024. Retrieved 15 January 2024.-

Data.event_text: 22 January - Ram Mandir Prana Pratishtha The Ram Mandir at Ayodhya in Uttar Pradesh is inaugurated by Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

links.text: -Mogul, Rhea; Sud, Vedika; Farooqui, Sania; Iyer, Aishwarya S; Taylor, Jerome (22 January 2024). "India's Ayodhya Ram Mandir temple inauguration". CNN. Retrieved 22 January 2024.-

Data.event_text: 25 January - French President Emmanuel Macron arrives in Jaipur as part of his two-day state visit to India and holds a joint roadshow with Indian Prime Minister Modi from Jantar Mantar to Sanganeri gate.

links.text: -"PM Modi, French President Macron hold mega roadshow in Jaipur conviction". India Today. 25 January 2024. Retrieved 26 January 2024.-

Data.event_text: 26 January - India's 75th Republic Day is celebrated with French President Macron participating as the Chief Guest.

links.text: -"Republic Day 2024: Emmanuel Macron chief guest, parade time, other key details conviction". The Hindustan Times. 26 January 2024. Retrieved 26 January 2024.-

Data.event_text: 28 January - 2024 Bihar political crisis Chief Minister of Bihar Nitish Kumar resigns, ending the coalition with the INDIA bloc and takes oath as the Chief Minister for the ninth time by joining the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP)-led NDA.

links.text: -"Breaking: Nitish Kumar takes oath as Bihar CM for the 9th time". The Times of India. 29 January 2024. Retrieved 29 January 2024.-

Data.event_text: Three Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) personnel are killed and 14 others injured in a Naxal attack near Tekalgudem village in Chhattisgarh.

links.text: -"3 CRPF jawans killed, 14 injured in Naxal attack in Chhattisgarh's Sukma". India Today. 31 January 2024. Retrieved 31 January 2024.-

Data.event_text: The historic Masjid Akhonji in Mehrauli, Delhi, is demolished by the Delhi Development Authority.

links.text: -"HC Asks Delhi Development Authority to Maintain Status Quo of Demolished Mosque Land". thewire.in. Retrieved 2024-12-16.-
-Mogul, Rhea (2024-02-15). "'Erasing a part of history' – What a double mosque demolition tells us about India ahead of crucial election". CNN. Retrieved 2024-12-16.-

Data.event_text: 31 January - Jharkhand Chief Minister Hemant Soren is arrested by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in connection with a money laundering case linked to a land scam.

links.text: -"Former Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren sent to 5-day ED custody". The Hindustan Times. 1 February 2024. Retrieved 4 February 2024.-

Data.event_text: 2 February - Champai Soren takes oath as the new Chief Minister of Jharkhand following the arrest of Hemant Soren.

links.text: -"Champai Soren sworn in as Jharkhand CM; Hemant in 5-day custody". The Hindustan Times. 1 February 2024. Retrieved 4 February 2024.-

Data.event_text: An explosion at a firecracker factory in Harda, Madhya Pradesh, leaves 11 dead, over 100 injured and destroys 60 nearby houses, leading to the evacuation of over 100 houses.

links.text: -"11 killed, over 100 hurt in blast at cracker factory in Madhya Pradesh's Harda". India Today. 6 February 2024. Retrieved 6 February 2024.-

Data.event_text: The Election Commission of India recognises Ajit Pawar's faction as the official Nationalist Congress Party  (NCP) and grants his faction the party's poll symbol and name, while directing Sharad Pawar's camp to take a new name.

links.text: -"Sharad Pawar Loses EC Battle As Ajit-led Faction Recognised As Real NCP". News18 India. 7 February 2024. Retrieved 7 February 2024.-

Data.event_text: 7 February - The Uttarakhand Legislative Assembly passes the Uniform Civil Code (UCC) bill 2024, making Uttarakhand the first state in India to pass a law on the same.

links.text: -"Uniform Civil Code bill passed in Uttarakhand assembly". The Hindustan Times. 7 February 2024. Retrieved 7 February 2024.-

Data.event_text: 8 February - 2024 Haldwani violence Four people are killed and over 100 are injured after clashes break out between rioters and police in Haldwani, Uttarakhand after the demolition of an illegal madrasa following a court order, prompting the suspension of internet services, closure of schools, and issuance of shoot-at-sight orders against the rioters.

links.text: -"Haldwani violence: 4 killed, 100 injured. Schools shut, internet suspended". The Hindustan Times. February 2023. Retrieved 9 February 2024.-
-"Uttarakhand: Riots in Haldwani after illegal madrasa demolished, shoot-at-sight orders issued, curfew imposed". BusinessToday. February 2023. Retrieved 9 February 2024.-

Data.event_text: Seven of the eight Indian Navy veterans who were released after being initially sentenced to death on espionage charges in Qatar, reach India.

links.text: -"Release of eight Indian Nationals detained in Qatar" (Press release). Ministry of External Affairs. 12 February 2023. Retrieved 12 February 2024.-
-"Qatar frees 8 Indian Navy veterans: Who are they? Why it's India's win?". The Hindustan Times. 12 February 2023. Retrieved 12 February 2024.-

Data.event_text: 2024 Indian farmers' protest Second round of protests and road blockades by farmers begin in the northern states of Punjab and Haryana, demanding Minimum Support Price and waiver of agricultural loans.

links.text: -"Angry farmers once forced India's hardline leader into a rare retreat. As the election looms, they're back". CNN. 26 February 2024. Retrieved 27 February 2024.-

Data.event_text: A unanimous judgement by the constitutional bench of the Supreme Court of India strikes down the Electoral bond scheme, stating it to be unconstitutional, arbitrary and violation of right to information under article 19 of the Constitution.

links.text: -"Supreme Court strikes down electoral bonds scheme: 'unconstitutional', 'arbitrary and violative of Article 14'". The Indian Express. 16 February 2024. Retrieved 16 February 2024.-

Data.event_text: A fire breaks out at a paint factory in Alipur, Delhi, resulting in 11 deaths and 4 injuries.

links.text: -"Delhi fire: 11 killed, 4 injured in massive blaze at Alipur paint factory". The Hindustan Times. 16 February 2024. Retrieved 16 February 2024.-

Data.event_text: ISRO launches the INSAT-3DS meteorological satellite.

links.text: -"GSLV-F14/INSAT-3DS Mission" (Press release). ISRO. 18 February 2024. Retrieved 18 February 2024.-
-"GSLV-F14 successfully places INSAT-3DS satellite in intended orbit: ISRO". The Hindu. Retrieved 18 February 2024.-

Data.event_text: 2024 Virudhunagar explosions A firecracker factory explosion in Virudhunagar district, Tamil Nadu, leaves 10 dead and seven injured.

links.text: -"10 dead, 7 injured in explosion at firecracker unit in Tamil Nadu". Deccan Herald. 17 February 2024. Retrieved 18 June 2024.-

Data.event_text: 23 February  2024 Indian farmers' protest A farmer dies amidst the ongoing protests, raising the death toll to five.

links.text: -"62-year-old dies, farmers' toll rises to 5 in 10 days of 2nd Delhi march". The Times of India. 24 February 2024. ISSN 0971-8257. Retrieved 24 February 2024.-
-"62-year-old dies, farmers' toll rises to 5 in 10 days of 2nd Delhi march". The Times of India. 24 February 2024. ISSN 0971-8257. Retrieved 24 February 2024.-

Data.event_text: 24 February  A tractor carrying a wagon loaded with Hindu pilgrims overturns and falls into a pond in Kasganj District, Uttar Pradesh, killing 23 people and injuring nine.

links.text: -"23 Hindu devotees die in northern India after a farm tractor overturns and falls into a pond". Associated Press. 24 February 2024. Retrieved 25 February 2024.-

Data.event_text: 25 February  Former MLA and then INLD state president Nafe Singh Rathee is shot and killed in Bahadurgarh, Jhajjar district, Haryana.

links.text: -"Haryana: INLD State President & Ex-MLA Nafe Singh Rathi Shot Dead In Bahadurgarh; Video Surfaces". Free Press Journal. 25 February 2024. Retrieved 25 February 2024.-

Data.event_text: 27 February - 2024 Rajya Sabha elections Elections are held to elect 65 of the 245 members of Rajya Sabha with the BJP winning 32 seats, two more than what it held previously at the expense of Indian National Congress, whose candidates lost in Himachal Pradesh and Uttar Pradesh due to cross voting of legislators from the Congress and the Samajwadi Party.

links.text: -Mayank Kumar; Vikas Vasudeva (27 February 2024). "Rajya Sabha polls | BJP gains in U.P., Himachal Pradesh amid cross-voting". The Hindu. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 27 March 2024.-
-Mayank Kumar; Vikas Vasudeva (27 February 2024). "Rajya Sabha polls | BJP gains in U.P., Himachal Pradesh amid cross-voting". The Hindu. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 27 March 2024.-

Data.event_text: 1 March  2024 Bangalore Cafe bombing At least eight people are injured after an improvised explosive device explodes in a café in Bengaluru.

links.text: -"Cafe Blasts Indias Bengaluru". Reuters. 1 March 2024. Retrieved 1 March 2024.-

Data.event_text: Election Commissioner Arun Goel resigns ahead of the general elections.

links.text: -Chakrabarty, Sreeparna (9 March 2024). "Arun Goel quits as Election Commissioner ahead of polls". The Hindu. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 12 March 2024.-
-Chakrabarty, Sreeparna (9 March 2024). "Arun Goel quits as Election Commissioner ahead of polls". The Hindu. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 12 March 2024.-

Data.event_text: The Miss World 2023 pageant is held in Mumbai.

links.text: -Bolledo, Jairo (9 March 2024). "Czech Republic's Krystyna Pyszková is 71st Miss World". Rappler. Archived from the original on 9 March 2024. Retrieved 14 March 2024.-
-Bolledo, Jairo (9 March 2024). "Czech Republic's Krystyna Pyszková is 71st Miss World". Rappler. Archived from the original on 9 March 2024. Retrieved 14 March 2024.-

Data.event_text: 11 March  The union government announces the implementation of the Citizenship Amendment Act, which enables persecuted minority communities from select religions (including Hindus, Sikhs, Jains, Christians, Buddhists, and Parsis) from India's neighboring countries Pakistan, Afghanistan and Bangladesh to acquire Indian citizenship.

links.text: -"Central government implements Citizenship Amendment Act". Hindustan Times. 11 March 2024. Retrieved 11 March 2024.-

Data.event_text: 12 March  The State Bank of India submits the data about electoral bonds before the Election Commission after the Supreme Court dismissed its plea seeking an extension up to 30 June for disclosing details about electoral bonds.

links.text: -Bhaumik, Aaratrika (11 March 2024). "Why did the Supreme Court reject SBI's plea seeking extension of time to disclose electoral bonds data?". The Hindu. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 12 March 2024.-
-Bhaumik, Aaratrika (11 March 2024). "Why did the Supreme Court reject SBI's plea seeking extension of time to disclose electoral bonds data?". The Hindu. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 12 March 2024.-
-"SBI submits electoral bonds details to EC: What comes next?". Live Mint. 13 March 2024. Retrieved 27 March 2024.-

Data.event_text: 14 March  The Election Commission publishes data on electoral bonds submitted by the State Bank.

links.text: -"Election Commission publishes electoral bond data with matching numbers". Business Standard. 14 March 2024. Retrieved 27 March 2024.-

Data.event_text: 16 March  Chief Election Commissioner Rajiv Kumar announces the schedule for the upcoming general elections.

links.text: -"Lok Sabha Election Date 2024: Seven-phase voting to begin from April 19, results on June 4; check dates, phases and other details". The Economic Times. 16 March 2024. Retrieved 27 March 2024.-

Data.event_text: 19 March  Two children are attacked and killed in Budaun with the suspect killed in an encounter by the Uttar Pradesh Police.

links.text: -"Father of Budaun murder victims sets bike on fire in rage — Police hiding". Live Mint. 20 March 2024. Retrieved 27 March 2024.-

Data.event_text: 21 March  Arrest of Arvind Kejriwal Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal is arrested by the Enforcement Directorate in connection with the Delhi excise policy case.

links.text: -"ED arrests Delhi CM Kejriwal: Who said what". The Times of India. 22 March 2024. Retrieved 27 March 2024.-

Data.event_text: Sonam Wangchuk ends his 21-day hunger strike demanding statehood for Ladakh.

links.text: -Ashiq, Peerzada (27 March 2024). "Activist Sonam Wangchuk ends hunger strike, says fight for Ladakh Statehood will go on". The Hindu. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 27 March 2024.-
-Ashiq, Peerzada (27 March 2024). "Activist Sonam Wangchuk ends hunger strike, says fight for Ladakh Statehood will go on". The Hindu. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 27 March 2024.-

Data.event_text: Two Chinese nationals are arrested by the Indian Police near the IndiaNepal border after they were intercepted entering Uttar Pradesh illegally.

links.text: -"Uttar Pradesh: Chinese Nationals arrested for illegal entry". India Today. 27 March 2024. Retrieved 27 March 2024.-

Data.event_text: 3 April  Seven people, including two children are killed in a fire at a tailoring shop in Aurangabad.

links.text: -"A fire in a tailoring shop in India kills 7, including children". Associated Press. 3 April 2024. Retrieved 30 April 2024.-

Data.event_text: 12 April  Two suspects in the March café bombing in Bengaluru are arrested in Kolkata.

links.text: -Dey, Sreyashi (12 April 2024). "Rameshwaram Cafe blast accused held near Kolkata in joint op but Bengal cops & Amit Malviya lock horns". The Print. Retrieved 30 April 2024.-

Data.event_text: 14 April  The BJP launches its manifesto for the 2024 Lok Sabha election titled ‘Sankalp Patra’ (Resolution Letter).

links.text: -Gireesh Chandra Prasad; Subhash Narayan; Dhirendra Kumar (14 April 202). "PM Modi unveils BJP 'Sankalp Patra' for 2024 Lok Sabha polls". Live Mint. Retrieved 30 April 2024.-

Data.event_text: At least six people are killed and three others are reported missing after a boat capsizes along the Jhelum River in Srinagar.

links.text: -"Rescuers search for 3 missing after boat capsizes in Indian-controlled Kashmir, killing at least 6". Associated Press. 16 April 2024. Retrieved 30 April 2024.-

Data.event_text: 2024 Kanker clash Twenty-nine Naxalites are killed and three members of the security forces are injured during a police raid in Kanker District, Chhattisgarh.

links.text: -"Indian police kill 29 suspected Maoist rebels in a gunbattle in a central state". Associated Press. April 17, 2024. Retrieved 30 April 2024.-

Data.event_text: 19 April1 June - 2024 Indian general election First of the seven phases of polling begins to elect members to the 18th Lok Sabha with the election expected to be the largest in history.

links.text: -"India's national election will take place in phases over 44 days. Here's why it takes so long". AP News. 18 March 2024. Retrieved 19 April 2024.-

Data.event_text: 2024 Arunachal Pradesh Legislative Assembly election
2024 Sikkim Legislative Assembly election
A restaurant fire that spreads to an adjacent hotel in Patna kills six people and injures 20.

links.text: -"Fire burns a restaurant and hotel in eastern India, killing 6 and injuring 20". Associated Press. 25 March 2024. Retrieved 30 April 2024.-

Data.event_text: 29 April  2024 Indian heat wave Two more people die in South India as a heatwave sweeps across India.

links.text: -"Two people die in southern India as heatwave scorches region". The Straits Times. 29 April 2024. ISSN 0585-3923. Retrieved 7 July 2024.-
-"Two people die in southern India as heatwave scorches region". The Straits Times. 29 April 2024. ISSN 0585-3923. Retrieved 7 July 2024.-

Data.event_text: 1 May  2024 Indian bomb hoaxes About 150 schools in Delhi receive bomb threats, prompting evacuation and closure of schools in the region.

links.text: -"Bomb Threat in Delhi-NCR Schools: Security Beefed Up Across National Capital; Case Filed". News18. 1 May 2024. Retrieved 1 May 2024.-
-"Bomb threat emails sent to 150 schools in Delhi traced to Budapest: Sources". India Today. 21 May 2024. Retrieved 31 May 2024.-

Data.event_text: 4 May  Minister of External Affairs S. Jaishankar rejects comments made by US President Joe Biden saying that India's economic growth was being held back by xenophobia.

links.text: -"India's foreign minister rejects Biden's 'xenophobia' comment". Reuters. 4 May 2024. Retrieved 31 May 2024.-

Data.event_text: 9 May  Air India Express cancels more than 85 flights due to staff calling in sick, linked to a protest against working conditions imposed by the new owner Tata Group.

links.text: -"India airline cancels dozens of flights after crew call in sick". Al Jazeera. Retrieved 31 May 2024.-

Data.event_text: The Supreme Court grants Arvind Kejriwal interim bail in connection with the Delhi liquor policy money laundering case thus permitting him to campaign in general elections.

links.text: -"Arvind Kejriwal News Highlights: Delhi CM welcomed by parents at home". The Hindustan Times. 10 May 2024. Retrieved 7 July 2024.-

Data.event_text: Security forces kill 12 Maoists in Chhattisgarh.

links.text: -"Indian security forces kill at least 12 Maoist rebels in gunbattle". Reuters. 10 May 2024. Retrieved 31 May 2024.-

Data.event_text: 13 May - 1 June   2024 Odisha Legislative Assembly election
Mumbai hoarding collapse 17 people are killed and 74 others are injured after an illegal hoarding collapses onto a gas station during a storm in the Ghatkopar suburb of Mumbai.

links.text: -"Billboard collapses onto people in Mumbai, India, killing at least 14 but others may be trapped". Associated Press. 14 May 2024. Retrieved 14 May 2024.-

Data.event_text: 2024 Andhra Pradesh Legislative Assembly election.
19 May  2024 Pune Porsche car crash A high speeding Porsche Taycan car driven by Vedant Agarwal under the influence of alcohol kills two software engineers in Kalyani Nagar, Pune.
The government declares a one-day state mourning in India for Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi following his death in a helicopter crash.

links.text: -"India declares state mourning on May 21 after Iran President Ebrahim Raisi's death". The Hindustan Times. 20 May 2024. Retrieved 22 May 2024.-

Data.event_text: Charges  of sexual harassment are filed against former Wrestling Federation of India president Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh in a Delhi court.

links.text: -Tripathi, Ashish (22 May 2024). "Delhi court frames charges against ex-WFI chief Brij Bhushan Singh in sexual harassment case; he pleads not guilty". Deccan Herald. Retrieved 31 May 2024.-

Data.event_text: 2024 Indian bomb hoaxes The North Block building of the Central Secretariat which houses the Home Ministry receives a bomb threat email that is subsequently dismissed as a hoax.

links.text: -"North Block, which houses Home Ministry, gets bomb threat email; security officials conduct searches". The Hindu. 22 May 2024. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 31 May 2024.-
-"North Block, which houses Home Ministry, gets bomb threat email; security officials conduct searches". The Hindu. 22 May 2024. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 31 May 2024.-

Data.event_text: The Calcutta High Court issues an order invalidating all Other Backward Classes (OBC) certificates issued by the Government of West Bengal since 2010.

links.text: -Das, Srinjoy (22 May 2024). "Calcutta High Court Cancels OBC Certificates Issued In West Bengal After 2010, Scraps OBC Classification Of 37 Communities". Live Mint. Retrieved 31 May 2024.-

Data.event_text: 23 May  2024 Thane explosion At least nine people are killed and 64 others injured after a fire caused by an exploding boiler breaks out at a chemical factory in Dombivli, outside Thane.

links.text: -"Fire breaks out after massive explosion at chemical factory in Thane". Financial Express. 23 May 2024. Retrieved 31 May 2024.-
-"8 Dead, More Than 60 Injured In Massive Blast At Chemical Factory In Thane District". News18. 23 May 2024. Retrieved 23 May 2024.-

Data.event_text: 2024 Rajkot gaming zone fire At least 33 people are killed including nine children in a fire at a gaming arcade in Rajkot, Gujarat.

links.text: -"India games arcade fire kills 20". BBC News. 25 May 2024. Retrieved 31 May 2024.-
-"Rajkot game zone fire live updates: Nine children among 33 killed; welding work likely cause of blaze, say sources". The Hindu. 26 May 2024. Retrieved 31 May 2024.-

Data.event_text: At least seven infants are killed in a fire in a baby care facility at a hospital in Shahdara, East Delhi.

links.text: -"Tragic fire at East Delhi's children's hospital; several newborns dead". The Hindu. 26 May 2024. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 31 May 2024.-
-"Tragic fire at East Delhi's children's hospital; several newborns dead". The Hindu. 26 May 2024. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 31 May 2024.-

Data.event_text: 26 May  Twelve people are killed during heavy rains as Cyclone Remal makes landfall at West Bengal.

links.text: -"Cyclone Remal impact: 394 flights affected, 2 killed in Bengal; 10 dead in Bangladesh". The Hindustan Times. Retrieved 31 May 2024.-

Data.event_text: 28 May  Seventeen people are killed and 12 others are reported missing after a stone quarry collapses due to heavy rains caused by cyclone Remal in Melthum, Mizoram.

links.text: -"At least 17 are killed when a stone quarry collapses in India's northeast. 12 others remain missing". Associated Press. 28 May 2024. Retrieved 31 May 2024.-

Data.event_text: 29 May  2024 Indian heat wave The India Meteorological Department records a maximum temperature of 52.3 °C (126.1 °F) at its station in the Mungeshpur area of Delhi, the highest ever temperature recorded in the city.

links.text: -"Heatwave in Delhi: At 52.3 celsius, Delhi records highest-ever temperature". The Hindu. 29 May 2024. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 31 May 2024.-
-"Heatwave in Delhi: At 52.3 celsius, Delhi records highest-ever temperature". The Hindu. 29 May 2024. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 31 May 2024.-

Data.event_text: A bus carrying Hindu pilgrims falls into a gorge in Jammu and Kashmir, killing 21 people and injuring 35 others.

links.text: -"Bus crashes into gorge in India-controlled Kashmir, killing at least 21 people". Associated Press. 30 May 2024. Retrieved 31 May 2024.-

Data.event_text: 2024 Indian heat wave At least 15 people die in a heatwave that affects northern and central India.

links.text: -"At least 15 dead in India as temperatures soar". BBC News. 31 May 2024. Retrieved 31 May 2024.-

Data.event_text: 31 May  Prajwal Revanna, Member of Parliament from Karnataka representing the Janata Dal (Secular), is arrested in Bengaluru over sexual assault charges.

links.text: -"India MP arrested in sex abuse case on return to country". BBC News. 31 May 2024. Retrieved 31 May 2024.-

Data.event_text: Results are declared for the 2024 Indian general election.

links.text: -"Follow the vote: India election live results 2024". Al Jazeera. 4 June 2024. Retrieved 21 June 2024.-

Data.event_text: 2024 NEET controversy  A controversy erupts due to the sudden declaration of the NEET-UG results 10 days earlier than the originally scheduled date amid allegations of irregularities and paper leaks.

links.text: -"Grace marks controversy: Parents term a scam in NEET-UG results, lodge complaint with officials, demand relief for affected students". The Times of India. 6 June 2024. ISSN 0971-8257. Retrieved 21 June 2024.-

-"Grace marks controversy: Parents term a scam in NEET-UG results, lodge complaint with officials, demand relief for affected students". The Times of India. 6 June 2024. ISSN 0971-8257. Retrieved 21 June 2024.-

Data.event_text: President Droupadi Murmu dissolves the 17th Lok Sabha.

links.text: -"President Droupadi Murmu dissolves 17th Lok Sabha". Deccan Herald. 8 June 2024. Retrieved 21 June 2024.-

Data.event_text: 6 June  2024 Uttarakhand snowstorm disaster A blizzard in Uttarakhand kills nine trekkers from Karnataka.

links.text: -"Blizzard in the Himalayas traps trekkers, killing nine from India". Reuters. 6 June 2024. Retrieved 21 June 2024.-

Data.event_text: 2024 Reasi attack Nine people are killed and 33 others are injured after a bus carrying Hindu pilgrims is attacked by Lashkar-e-Taiba militants near Reasi, Jammu and Kashmir.

links.text: -"At least nine killed after attack on bus in Indian-administered Kashmir". Al Jazeera. 9 June 2024. Retrieved 21 June 2024.-

Data.event_text: Narendra Modi is sworn in for his third term as Prime Minister of India.

links.text: -"India's Narendra Modi sworn in as country's prime minister for a third term". Al Jazeera. 9 June 2024. Retrieved 21 June 2024.-

Data.event_text: 11 June - Kannada cinema actor Darshan is arrested by Karnataka Police in connection with a murder case.

links.text: -"From Kiccha Sudeep to Upendra, actors react to Darshan's arrest in murder case". The News Minute. 17 May 2024. Retrieved 21 June 2024.-

Data.event_text: 12 June  The Indian external affairs ministry issues a notice urging the Russian Government to quickly return all Indian nationals who are serving in the Russian army after two Indians recruited are killed in the war with Ukraine.

links.text: -"War in Ukraine: Two Indian nationals recruited by Russia killed". BBC news. 13 June 2024. Retrieved 21 June 2024.-

Data.event_text: 2024 Northeast India floods Heavy rains and landslides kill six people across Sikkim.

links.text: -"Heavy rain, landslides kill 6 in India's Sikkim, 2,000 tourists stranded". Reuters. 14 June 2024. Retrieved 14 June 2024.-

Data.event_text: The World Health Organization officially confirms a human Influenza A virus subtype H9N2 case in a child in West Bengal.

links.text: -"WHO confirms human case of bird flu in India! H9N2 virus detected in a four-year child in West Bengal". Business Insider. 15 June 2024. Retrieved 21 June 2024.-

Data.event_text: 17 June  2024 West Bengal train collision A goods train collides with the Kanchenjunga Express near New Jalpaiguri station in Darjeeling District, West Bengal, killing 15 people and injuring 60 others.

links.text: -"Train crash in eastern India kills 15, injures dozens". Reuters. 17 June 2024. Retrieved 21 June 2024.-

Data.event_text: 19 June  2024 Northeast India floods Six people are killed in flooding and landslides in Assam.

links.text: -"Landslides kill at least 15, displace millions, in Bangladesh and India". Al Jazeera. 19 June 2024. Retrieved 21 June 2024.-

Data.event_text: 20 June  2024 Tamil Nadu alcohol poisoning At least 47 people are reported killed after suffering methanol poisoning caused by tainted liquor in Kallakurichi district in Tamil Nadu.

links.text: -"Illegally brewed liquor kills at least 34 with dozens hospitalized in southern India". Associated Press. 20 June 2024. Retrieved 21 June 2024.-
-"Death toll in Kallakurichi hooch tragedy climbs to 47". The Hindu. 21 June 2024. Retrieved 21 June 2024.-

Data.event_text: 21 June  A Valentine's Day film released.
22 June  Subodh Kumar Singh is dismissed as the director general of the National Testing Agency following uproar over the 2024 NEET controversy.

links.text: -"India exam chief sacked after outcry over marks". BBC News. 22 June 2024. Retrieved 22 June 2024.-

Data.event_text: 27 June  President Droupadi Murmu inaugurates the 18th Lok Sabha.

links.text: -"India's president inaugurates newly elected parliament and sets out economic reforms as a key agenda". Associated Press. Retrieved 28 June 2024.-

Data.event_text: 28 June  One person is killed after a roof at Terminal 1 of Indira Gandhi International Airport in Delhi collapses amid heavy rains.

links.text: -"One dead as roof collapse smashes cars at Delhi airport". BBC News. 28 June 2024. Retrieved 28 June 2024.-

Data.event_text: Five soldiers are killed after an Indian Army tank sinks while crossing the Shyok River in Saser Brangsa, Ladakh.

links.text: -"An Indian military tank sinks while crossing a river in a region bordering China, killing 5 soldiers". Associated Press. 29 June 2024. Retrieved 29 June 2024.-

Data.event_text: 2024 Virudhunagar explosions An explosion firecracker factory in Virudhunagar district in Tamil Nadu leaves four dead and one injured.

links.text: -"4 Workers Killed, 1 Injured In Firecracker Unit Blast In Tamil Nadu: Cops". NDTV. 29 June 2024. Retrieved 29 June 2024.-

Data.event_text: India beat South Africa and wins the 2024 ICC Men's T20 World Cup.
30 June  2024 Lonavala waterfall tragedy Five people, including four children, are swept away by sudden flooding near a waterfall close to Bhushi Dam in Lonavala, Maharashtra.

links.text: -"Pune waterfall tragedy: all 5 bodies found". The Hindu. 2 July 2024. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 7 July 2024.-
-"Pune waterfall tragedy: all 5 bodies found". The Hindu. 2 July 2024. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 7 July 2024.-

Data.event_text: 1 July  The Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita and two other laws passed in 2023 come into effect as the country's criminal codes, replacing the Indian Penal Code and related laws enacted during the colonial era.

links.text: -"Concerns as India replaces colonial-era laws with new criminal codes". Al Jazeera. 1 July 2024. Retrieved 2 July 2024.-

Data.event_text: 2 July  2024 Uttar Pradesh crowd crush  At least 123 people die in a crowd crush at a religious event in Rati Bhanpur village within the Sikandra Rau area of Hathras district, Uttar Pradesh.

links.text: -"107 people killed in stampede at religious event in Uttar Pradesh's Hathras". The Hindustan Times. 2 July 2024. Retrieved 2 July 2024.-

Data.event_text: 23 July  2024 India-Bangladesh floods At least sixteen people are killed by floods and landslides in Assam and Arunachal Pradesh, while over 300,000 more are displaced.

links.text: -"Six dead as floods inundate vast swath of India, Bangladesh". France 24. 3 July 2024. Retrieved 3 July 2024.-
-"Air Force rescues 13 fishermen as floods in India's northeast kill 16 people". The Independent. 3 July 2024. Retrieved 3 July 2024.-

Data.event_text: 5 July  A victory parade is held in Mumbai by the Indian cricket team following their victory in the 2024 ICC Men's T20 World Cup.

links.text: -"India outwit SA by seven runs to clinch T20 World Cup". Deccan Herald. 29 June 2024. Retrieved 29 June 2024.-
-"India's victory parade". ESPNcricinfo. 5 July 2024. Retrieved 5 July 2024.-

Data.event_text: 6 July  2024 Surat building collapse At least seven people are killed and more than 15 others injured in the collapse of a residential building in Surat, Gujarat.

links.text: -"Surat disaster: 7 found dead in rubble of collapsed 6-storey building, more feared trapped". Business Today. 7 July 2024. Retrieved 7 July 2024.-

Data.event_text: 7 July  Two soldiers and six militants are killed during two separate encounters in Kulgam district, Jammu and Kashmir.

links.text: -"Kulgam encounter: Death toll climbs to eight". The Economic Times. 7 July 2024. Retrieved 7 July 2024.-
-"Two Indian soldiers, six rebels killed in Kashmir gun battles". Al Jazeera. 7 July 2024. Retrieved 7 July 2024.-

Data.event_text: 8 July  Five soldiers are killed in an ambush by militants in Kathua district, Jammu and Kashmir.

links.text: -"Five Indian soldiers killed in Kashmir ambush". BBC. 9 July 2024. Retrieved 9 July 2024.-

Data.event_text: 10 July  Eighteen people are killed after a double-decker bus collides with a milk truck in Uttar Pradesh.

links.text: -"A double-decker bus collides with a milk truck in northern India, killing at least 18 people". Associated Press. 10 July 2024. Retrieved 10 July 2024.-

Data.event_text: 12 July  The wedding of Anant Ambani, the second son of Asia's richest-man Mukesh Ambani, and heiress Radhika Merchant is held in Mumbai in a lavish ceremony attended by international VIPs.

links.text: -"Indian billionaire heir Anant Ambani weds at lavish, star-studded ceremony". CNN. July 12, 2024. Retrieved July 13, 2024.-

Data.event_text: Eleven people are killed by heavy downpours and flooding in Delhi and North India and over 250 people are declared missing in and around the Himalayas, with rainfall reaching 183 mm (7 inches) in some regions.

links.text: -"Olympics.com".-

Data.event_text: China and India conduct the 30th round of talks in New Delhi, to resolve the ongoing border disputes, by agreeing to speed up negotiations over the border disputes and to maintain peace and tranquility in border regions.

links.text: -"Rain in Delhi, northern India kills 11, hundreds missing". Reuters. August 1, 2024.-

Data.event_text: Swapnil Kusale wins a bronze medal in Men's 50 meter rifle three positions at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris.

links.text: -"China, India agree to speed up border negotiations at 30th round of talks". South China Morning Post. 2024-08-01. Retrieved 2024-08-01.-

Data.event_text: The India men's national field hockey team wins a bronze medal at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris.

links.text: -"Olympics.com".-

Data.event_text: Neeraj Chopra wins a silver medal in Javelin throw at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris.

links.text: -"Olympics.com".-

Data.event_text: Aman Sehrawat wins a bronze medal in Men's freestyle 57 kilograms at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris.

links.text: -"Olympics.com".-

Data.event_text: 2024 Kolkata rape and murderThe rape and murder of a female 31 year old post-graduate trainee doctor at the state-run R. G. Kar Medical College and Hospital in Kolkata sparks outrage and nationwide protests.

links.text: -"Olympics.com".-
-"What happened to Dr. Moumita Debnath at RG Kar Medical College?". Hindi Patrika (in Hindi). Archived from the original on 14 August 2024. Retrieved 14 August 2024.-
-"What happened to Dr. Moumita Debnath at RG Kar Medical College?". Hindi Patrika (in Hindi). Archived from the original on 14 August 2024. Retrieved 14 August 2024.-

Data.event_text: 12 August  At least seven people are killed and 10 others are injured in a crowd crush believed to have been caused by a clash between a flower vendor and Hindu worshippers at the Baba Siddhnath Temple in Jehanabad District, Bihar.

links.text: -"National strike held over India doctor's murder". BBC. Retrieved 17 August 2024.-

Data.event_text: 21 August  At least 18 people are killed and 37 others are injured in an explosion at a pharmaceutical factory in Anakapalli district, Andhra Pradesh.

links.text: -"At least seven people killed, several injured in stampede at Jehanabad's Baba Siddhnath in Bihar". The Hindu. 12 August 2024.-

Data.event_text: At least 19 people are reported killed following days of flooding in Tripura.

links.text: -"Explosion and fire at a pharmaceutical plant in India kill at least 18 workers". Associated Press. 22 August 2024.-

Data.event_text: During a meeting in Kyiv, Narendra Modi urges Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy to end the Russo-Ukrainian War, and volunteers to act as a mediator in talks between Zelenskyy and Russia. In a later national address, Zelenskyy thanks Modi but states that it is necessary for India to respect international law as well as Ukraine's territorial integrity and sovereignty.

links.text: -"As more floods batter Bangladesh and India, death toll rises to 30". Associated Press. 23 August 2024.-

Data.event_text: 29 August  At least 28 people are reported killed following days of flooding in Gujarat.

links.text: -"In Kyiv, Indian PM urges Zelenskiy to sit down for talks with Russia". Reuters. August 23, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 4 September  The 2024 Tripura Peace Accord is signed between the National Liberation Front of Tripura and the All Tripura Tiger Force on one side and the State Government of Tripura and the Government of India on the other, ending the 35-year old Insurgency in Tripura.

links.text: -"Monsoon floods in India's Gujarat kill at least 28 people". France 24. 29 August 2024.-
-"Historic Peace Agreement Signed Between the Governments of India, Tripura, NLFT & ATTF at New Delhi". Northeast Now. Retrieved 2024-09-04.-

Data.event_text: At least five people are killed in clashes between the Kuki and Meitei communities in Jiribam District, Manipur.

links.text: -"2 insurgent groups in Tripura sign peace deal; Amit Shah says 'matter of joy for all'". Hindustan Times. Retrieved 2024-09-04.-

Data.event_text: At least eight people are killed in a building collapse in Lucknow.

links.text: -"At least five killed as ethnic violence flares in India's Manipur". Al Jazeera. Retrieved 2024-09-07.-

Data.event_text: The UPSC dismisses and cancels the candidature of trainee IAS officer Puja Khedkar due to her fraulent methods of clearing the UPSC exam.

links.text: -"Building collapse in India's Lucknow kills eight, injures dozens". Aljazeera. 7 September 2024. Retrieved 2 January 2025.-
-"UPSC cancels provisional candidature of Ms. Puja Manorama Dilip Khedkar and permanently debars her from all the future Exams/Selections". PIB India. 2024-07-31. Retrieved 2024-07-31.-

Data.event_text: 10 September  A five-day curfew and internet blackout is imposed in Manipur due to interethnic violence.

links.text: -"Puja Khedkar dismissed from IAS weeks after UPSC cancelled her selection". Hindustan Times. 7 September 2024. Retrieved 2 January 2025.-

Data.event_text: 12 September  The Ministry of External Affairs says that about 45 Indian nationals have been discharged from the Russian army and efforts are under way to get a further 50 Indians released.

links.text: -"India's Manipur imposes curfew, cuts internet to quell escalating violence". Al Jazeera. Retrieved 2024-09-10.-

Data.event_text: 13 September  Two soldiers are killed in clashes with separatists in Kishtwar, Jammu and Kashmir.

links.text: -"Russia discharges 45 Indians fighting in its army". Reuters. September 12, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 15 September  Arvind Kejriwal announces his resignation as Chief Minister of Delhi effective 17 September. He is succeeded by Atishi Marlena Singh.

links.text: -"2 Soldiers Killed In Action In J&K, 2 Terrorists Shot Dead In Another Op". NDTV.com. Retrieved 2024-09-14.-
-"New Delhi's chief minister announces resignation two days after he was released on bail". Associated Press. 15 September 2024. Retrieved 2024-09-15.-

Data.event_text: 17 September  The Supreme Court of India quashes criminal proceedings against 30 soldiers accused of orchestrating the 2021 Nagaland killings, citing the lack of government approval for prosecution.

links.text: -"Atishi to be new chief minister of India's capital territory Delhi". Al Jazeera. 15 September 2024. Retrieved 15 September 2024.-

Data.event_text: 18 September6 October  2024 Jammu and Kashmir Legislative Assembly election An alliance between the Congress party and the Jammu & Kashmir National Conference wins 48 of 90 seats in the state chamber.

links.text: -"Fury as India quashes charges for botched army ambush". France 24. 18 September 2024. Retrieved 18 September 2024.-
-"India's Kashmir holds first regional election since losing autonomy". Al Jazeera. 18 September 2024.-

Data.event_text: Ernst & Young employee Anna Sebastian Perayil working at Pune dies due to work pressure in July 2024.

links.text: -"Indian Kashmir elects first regional government in a decade". France 24. 8 October 2024.-
-"After EY Pune CA Death, MNC Employee's X Post On Working 17 To 18 Hours, Attending 5 AM Meeting Draws Reaction". English Jagran. 2024-09-19. Retrieved 2024-09-19.-

Data.event_text: Laboratory tests reveal the usage of beef and other animal fats with fish oil in the preparations of Tirupati laddu sweets offered at the Tirupati Temple in Andhra Pradesh, sparking political uproar in the state.

links.text: -"Grieving mom's heart-wrenching letter blames toxic culture for daughter's death". Times Entertainment. 2024-09-18. Retrieved 2024-09-18.-
-Meenakshi, Anjana; Rajendran, Dhanya (2024-09-20). "Tirupati laddu ghee adulteration row: What the lab reports say". The News Minute. Retrieved 2024-09-23.-

Data.event_text: 20 September  At least 26 people are killed in West Bengal following a week of flooding blamed by state officials on dams being opened in neighbouring Jharkhand state.

links.text: -Pandey, Geeta (2024-09-27). "A famed holy sweet in an unsavoury row in India". BBC. Retrieved 2024-09-23.-

Data.event_text: 24 September  The first case of clade 1b mpox in India is discovered in a 38-year-old patient in Malappuram District, Kerala who had recently travelled to the United Arab Emirates.

links.text: -"India minister blames dam release for flooding". France 24. 20 September 2024.-

Data.event_text: 2024 Jivitputrika tragedy At least 46 people taking part in Jivitputrika festivities drown in rivers and bodies of water swollen by flooding across Bihar . Thirty-seven of the victims are children.

links.text: -"India confirms first mpox case in current outbreak". BBC. 24 September 2024.-

Data.event_text: Up to 275 millimeters (11 inches) of rain falls across Mumbai, causing at least four deaths.

links.text: -"Dozens of children drown during Hindu festival in India". Reuters. September 26, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 27 September  A Class 2 student is killed in a "tantric sacrificial rite" performed by the owners of his school in Hathras district, Uttar Pradesh for the "prosperity" of the institute.

links.text: -"Heavy rains snarl traffic, shut schools in Mumbai and nearby regions". September 26, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 4 October  A truck collides with a tractor trolley in Bhadohi district, Uttar Pradesh, killing 10 and injuring three.

links.text: -Tewari, Samridhi (2024-09-27). "Uttar Pradesh's Hathras class 2 boy 'sacrificed' for school's prosperity; five held". The Hindu. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 2024-09-28.-
-Tewari, Samridhi (2024-09-27). "Uttar Pradesh's Hathras class 2 boy 'sacrificed' for school's prosperity; five held". The Hindu. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 2024-09-28.-

Data.event_text: 2024 Abujhmarh clash More than 36 Maoists are killed in an operation carried out by District Reserve Guards and Special Task Force in the Abujhmarh forest area in Chhattisgarh.

links.text: -"Road crash in UP leaves 10 dead, 3 injured; PM, CM announce ex-gratia". The Business Standard. October 4, 2024. Retrieved February 17, 2025.-

Data.event_text: 2024 Haryana Legislative Assembly election The BJP retains control of the state Legislative Assembly for a record third term, winning 48 of 90 seats.

links.text: -"36 Maoists Killed In Encounter Along Dantewada Border In Chhattisgarh". NDTV. Retrieved 2024-10-04.-
-"Kashmir and Haryana prove India exit polls wrong". BBC. Retrieved 2024-10-08.-

Data.event_text: 6 October - At least 5 people are killed and many others are hospitalized due to dehydration caused in a crowd crush in the celebration of the 92nd anniversary of the Indian Air Force in Chennai, Tamil Nadu.

links.text: -"'Big setback': Why India's Congress lost out to Modi in key state election". Al Jazeera. Retrieved 2024-10-09.-

Data.event_text: 11 October- 2024 Tamil Nadu train collision  A Mysuru Dharbhanga train collides with a freight train on a loop line in Chennai, injuring 19 people.

links.text: -"5 Spectators Die After Air Force's Chennai Airshow". NDTV. 7 October 2024. Retrieved 7 October 2024.-

Data.event_text: 12 October  Former Maharashtra state minister Baba Siddique is shot dead in Mumbai.

14 October  India recalls its high commissioner to Canada Sanjay Kumar Verma in retaliation to Ottawa placing him and other Indian diplomats under investigation over the murder of Canadian national and Sikh separatist Hardeep Singh Nijjar in 2023. It also orders the expulsion of Canada's acting high commissioner Stewart Ross Wheeler and five other diplomats.

links.text: -"Indian politician Baba Siddique shot dead in Mumbai". BBC. 13 October 2024.-
-"India to recall top envoy to Canada: foreign ministry". France 24. 14 October 2024.-

Data.event_text: 18 October  A migrant worker from Bihar is found shot dead by suspected militants in Shopian District, Jammu and Kashmir.

links.text: -"India and Canada expel top diplomats over murder accusations". BBC. 15 October 2024.-

Data.event_text: 20 October  Seven workers on a tunnel project are killed in an attack by militants on their camp in Gagangir, Jammu and Kashmir.

links.text: -"India and Canada expel top diplomats over murder accusations". BBC. 15 October 2024.-

Data.event_text: 21 October  India announces an agreement with China regarding military patrols along the Line of Actual Control between their countries.
25 October  At least two people are killed after Cyclone Dana makes landfall in Odisha.

links.text: -"India says it reached deal with China on army patrols along disputed border". Al Jazeera. 21 October 2024.-

Data.event_text: 27 October - 2024 Mumbai stampede A stampede occurs at the Bandra Terminus railway station in Mumbai, injuring nine people, two of them critically.

links.text: -"Cyclone Dana Highlights: 2 Dead In West Bengal; Waterlogging Brings Kolkata To A Halt". NDTV. 26 October 2024.-
-"Stampede at Mumbai's Bandra railway station leaves at least nine injured". The Hindu. 27 October 2024. Retrieved 27 October 2024.-

Data.event_text: The first private military aircraft manufacturing facility in India is inaugurated in Vadodara as part of a joint venture between Airbus and Tata Advanced Systems.

links.text: -"Stampede at Mumbai's Bandra railway station leaves 9 injured". The Indian Express. 27 October 2024. Retrieved 27 October 2024.-

Data.event_text: At least 150 people are injured after an explosion caused by a fire at a fireworks storage facility near the Veerarkavu temple in Kasargod, Kerala.

links.text: -"Modi, Spain's Sanchez launch India's first private military aircraft plant". Al Jazeera. 28 October 2024.-

Data.event_text: 2931 October  At least ten elephants die from suspected fungus poisoning from consuming contaminated millet in Bandhavgarh National Park, Madhya Pradesh.

links.text: -"An explosion of fireworks injures more than 150 people at a temple in India". Associated Press. 29 October 2024.-

Data.event_text: 3 November  Nine people are injured in a grenade attack on a market in Srinagar.

links.text: -"Alarm over death of 10 elephants in India national park". BBC. 7 November 2024.-

Data.event_text: 3 November - The India national cricket team are defeated for the first time at home in a test series by the New Zealand national cricket team.

links.text: -"A grenade explosion in a busy market in Indian-controlled Kashmir wounds 9". Associated Press. Retrieved 2024-11-03.-

Data.event_text: 4 November 2024 Almora bus accident  A bus falls off a gorge in Marchula, Uttarakhand, killing 36 people and injuring 27 others.

links.text: -"New Zealand do the unthinkable and hand India their first 3-0 whitewash at home". ESPNcricinfo. 3 November 2024. Retrieved 2024-12-29.-

Data.event_text: 6 November  The Jammu and Kashmir Legislative Assembly passes a resolution calling on the union government to restore semi-autonomous status for the region.

links.text: -"At least 36 die after bus falls into a gorge in India". BBC. Retrieved 2024-11-04.-

Data.event_text: Vistara ceases operations after nine years in operation following a merger agreement with Air India.

links.text: -"Kashmir legislature passes resolution asking India to restore its partial autonomy". Associated Press. Retrieved 2024-11-06.-

Data.event_text: Ten members of the Hmar people are killed in disputed circumstances by paramilitary forces near Jiribam, Manipur.

links.text: -"India's luxury airline Vistara flies into the sunset". BBC. Retrieved 2024-11-11.-

Data.event_text: 1320 November  2024 Jharkhand Legislative Assembly election The Jharkhand Mukti Morcha-led alliance wins a majority in the Jharkhand Legislative Assembly.

links.text: -"Parts of Manipur state in northeast India shut down after 10 people killed by security forces". Associated Press. Retrieved 2024-11-12.-

Data.event_text: 13 November  The Supreme Court outlaws the government's practice of outright demolishing the homes of people accused of criminal offences.

links.text: -"Modi's Hindu nationalist party heads for sweeping win in Maharashtra state election". Associated Press. Retrieved 2024-11-23.-

Data.event_text: 15 November  At least ten infants are killed in a fire at the neonatal ward of a hospital in Jhansi.

links.text: -"India's top court bans 'bulldozer justice' as punishment". BBC. Retrieved 2024-11-13.-

Data.event_text: 16 November  India successfully launches its first hypersonic missile at a test site in Abdul Kalam Island.

links.text: -"Parents 'grabbed any child they could' in Indian hospital fire that killed 10 babies". BBC. Retrieved 2024-11-16.-

Data.event_text: 20 November  2024 Maharashtra Legislative Assembly election The BJP-led alliance gets a landslide victory in the Maharashtra Legislative Assembly.

links.text: -"India hails 'historic' hypersonic missile test flight". France 24. Retrieved 2024-11-17.-

Data.event_text: 22 November  An Indian Navy submarine collides with a fishing vessel off the coast of Goa, leaving two fishermen missing.

links.text: -"Modi's party set to return to power in India's richest state". BBC. Retrieved 2024-11-23.-

Data.event_text: 24 November 2024 Sambhal violence Four people are killed following clashes over a court-monitored survey on a mosque in Sambhal, Uttar Pradesh.

links.text: -"Indian Navy submarine collides with fishing vessel off Goa, 2 fishermen still missing". The Hindustan Times. Retrieved 2024-12-19.-

Data.event_text: 26 November  Thirteen-year old Vaibhav Suryavanshi becomes the youngest person to sign a contract to play in the Indian Premier League after joining the Rajasthan Royals for 11 million rupees.

links.text: -"Four dead in violence over mosque survey in Indian city". BBC. Retrieved 2024-11-25.-

Data.event_text: 30 November  Cyclone Fengal makes landfall in Tamil Nadu, killing three people.

links.text: -"The 13-year-old Indian cricketer who won a $130,500 IPL deal". BBC. Retrieved 2024-11-26.-

Data.event_text: 1 December  At least one person is killed and three others are injured in the collapse of an under-construction tunnel of the DelhiMumbai Expressway in Kota, Rajasthan.

links.text: -"Cyclone Fengal toll rises to 20 in South Asia". France 24. Retrieved 2024-12-02.-
-"Highways authority to inspect tunnel collapse on Delhi-Mumbai Expressway in Kota". India TV. December 1, 2024. Retrieved January 27, 2025.-

Data.event_text: 3 December  The Bangladeshi consulate in Agartala is stormed by protesters demonstrating against the arrest of Hindu community leader Chinmoy Krishna Das in Chittagong.

links.text: -"1 dead, 3 injured as under-construction tunnel collapses on Delhi-Mumbai Expressway in Kota". The Times Of India. December 2, 2024. Retrieved January 27, 2025.-

Data.event_text: 4 December  A ban on the public consumption of beef comes into effect in Assam.

links.text: -"Bangladesh court defers Hindu leader's bail hearing as tensions with India spike". Associated Press. Retrieved 2024-12-08.-

Data.event_text: 9 December  A bus ploughs through a crowd at a market in Mumbai, killing nine and injuring 29.

links.text: -"Indian state bans eating beef in public". BBC. Retrieved 2024-12-05.-

Data.event_text: 9 December  The suicide of Atul Subhash in Bengaluru generates discussion over the effects of dowry laws on men.

links.text: -https://www.msn.com/en-in/public-safety-and-emergencies/traffic-and-transportation-incidents/mumbai-bus-crash-kurla-mishap-death-toll-climbs-to-9-best-driver-may-lose-licence/ar-AA1wbLbq-

Data.event_text: 11 December  Sanjay Malhotra is inaugurated as governor of the Reserve Bank of India.

links.text: -https://www.livemint.com/news/india/who-is-family-judge-rita-kaushik-mentioned-in-bengaluru-techie-atul-subhashs-suicide-note-what-are-the-allegations-11733910721491.html-

Data.event_text: 12 December  Eighteen-year old Gukesh Dommaraju of Chennai becomes the youngest person to win the World Chess Championship.

links.text: -"India's new central bank governor takes over as economic growth slows and inflation rises". Associated Press. Retrieved 2024-12-11.-

Data.event_text: 1314 December  Actor Allu Arjun is arrested overnight on charges involving the death of a woman at a stampede during a film event in Hyderabad.

links.text: -"Indian teen becomes youngest world chess champion". BBC. Retrieved 2024-12-12.-

Data.event_text: A bill calling for the synchronisation of state and general elections fails to pass in the Lok Sabha.

links.text: -"Popular actor in southern India is freed on bail after spending a night in jail in a stampede case". Associated Press. Retrieved 2024-12-15.-

Data.event_text: 2024 Mumbai boat accident An Indian Navy speedboat collides with a ferry traveling from Mumbai to Elephanta Island, killing 13 people.

links.text: -"Proposal to change India's voting system to allow simultaneous polls fails to pass lower Parliament". Associated Press. Retrieved 2024-12-18.-

Data.event_text: 19 December  Five suspected militants are killed in an encounter with security forces in Kulgam district, Jammu and Kashmir.

links.text: -"13 die as an Indian navy speedboat crashes into a passenger ferry off Mumbai". Associated Press. Retrieved 2024-12-18.-

Data.event_text: 23 December  The Delhi High Court denies anticipatory bail to trainee IAS officer Puja Khedkar on using fraulent methods to clear the UPSC exam.

links.text: -"5 suspected militants killed in Kashmir fighting, Indian military says". AP News. 2024-12-19. Retrieved 2024-12-19.-

Data.event_text: 25 December  A female engineering student is sexually assaulted by two men inside the Anna University in Chennai.

links.text: -"Intention To Dupe UPSC": Ex-IAS Trainee Puja Khedkar Denied Pre-Arrest Bail". NDTV. 2024-12-21. Retrieved 2024-12-21.-
